title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 16, ch. VI, subch. A, pt. 609 - Rules Governing Provision Of Telephone Service To Residential Customers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 16, ch. VI, subch. A, pt. 609 - Rules Governing Provision Of Telephone Service To Residential Customers

§ 609.1 - Purpose
§ 609.2 - Applicability of rules
§ 609.3 - Applications for residential basic local exchange service
§ 609.4 - Suspension or termination of basic local exchange service
§ 609.5 - Suspension or termination of residential basic local exchange service-special procedures
§ 609.6 - Voluntary third-party notice prior to termination of service
§ 609.7 - Reconnection of service
§ 609.8 - Deferred payment agreements
§ 609.9 - Residential basic local exchange service deposits
§ 609.10 - Backbilling on residential accounts
§ 609.11 - Adjusted payments and other charges
§ 609.12 - Contents of bills
§ 609.13 - Notification requirements
§ 609.14 - Emergency disconnections of residences
§ 609.15 - Inspection and examination of telephone corporation apparatus
§ 609.16 - Telephone corporation complaint-handling procedures
§ 609.17 - Waiver
§ 609.18 - Use of Preferred Name and Pronoun

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 16, ch. VI, subch. A, pt. 609

Statutory authority: Public Service Law, §§ 4[1], 92[1]
State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
